sen.j: 時服（じふく）は、毎年、春と秋とに、または夏と冬とに、朝廷から皇親以下諸臣に賜った衣服である。
sen.e: "Jifuku" means the clothes, or allocations of these clothes, bestowed by Imperial Court to the Emperor's family members and their retainers in spring and autumn or in summer and winter, every year.

sen.j: 「禄令」には、皇親で年13以上のものに時服の料として、春は絁（あしぎぬ）2疋、糸2絢、布4端、鍬10口、秋は絁2疋、綿2屯、布6端、鉄4挺をたまうという規定がある。
sen.e: According to the rules specified in "Rokuryo" (the "rules on stipends"), koshin (Emperor's family members) of more than thirteen years old were entitled to receive such jifuku materials in spring as two rolls of thick silk fabrics, two spools of yarn, four pieces of about 15m long cloth and ten spades, and in autumn such jifuku materials as two rolls of thick silk fabrics, two tons (old measuring unit in the acient Japan) of cotton, six pieces of cloth and four pieces of iron products.
sen.cmt: ①「禄令」の定訳不明。 ②「年13以上」も意味不明ですが「年齢13歳以上」と解釈して訳しました。 ③「糸2絢」の「絢（あや・ケン）」は「きらびやかな」という意味はありますが、糸の量を測る単位として使用されている例は見当たりません。意味・読み共に不明ですが、"two spools of yarn"と訳しておきました。 ④「布4端」の「端」は「反」の意味で、長さ5丈2尺・幅2尺4寸の布を1端（1反）としたようです。英訳は"four pieces of about 15m long cloth"と訳しておきました。 ⑤「鉄4挺」の「挺」は鉄砲などの数量単位ですが、ここでの「鉄」とは何を指すのかが不明。訳文は"four pieces of iron products"としておきました。
sen.e: According to the rules specified in "Rokuryo" (the "rules on stipends"), koshin (Emperor's family members) of more than thirteen years old were entitled to receive such jifuku materials in spring as two rolls of thick silk fabrics, two spools of yarn, four pieces of about 15m long cloth and ten spades, and in autumn such jifuku materials as two rolls of thick silk fabrics, two tons (old measuring unit in the ancient Japan) of cotton, six pieces of cloth and four pieces of iron products.
sen.cmt: スペルミス： acient → ancient に訂正しました。

sen.j: 本来、皇親と言えども官職についていない者及び品位が授けられていない者（とりわけ内親王などの女性皇族）を経済的に保護する目的があった。
sen.e: The purpose of this jifuku system was to economically support koshin (Emperor's family members) holding no official post nor court rank (particularly, imperial princesses and other female royalties)

sen.j: なお、官職についている皇親が五位以上に達した場合は季禄と比較して多い方を支給した（『令義解』、ただし『延喜式』には両方支給するとしている）。
sen.e: If any koshin member, holding a government post, was ranked at goi (the fifth rank) or higher position, he was entitled to receive either jifuku or kiroku (stipends) whichever higher it may be, according to the "Ryo-no-gige," although in the "Engishiki"(an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers) both jifuku and kiroku were reportedly paid to them.

If any koshin member holding a government post, was promoted to goi (the fifth rank) or higher position, he was entitled to receive either jifuku or kiroku (stipends) whichever higher it may be, according to the "Ryo-no-gige" (commentary on the Ryo), although the "Engishiki"(an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers) says both jifuku and kiroku were given to him.
sen.cmt: 「達した」の意味を出すため、was ranked at goi (the fifth rank) or hight position → was promoted to more than goi (the fifth rank) or higher position に変更しました。最初のmember の後のコンマは必要ないのではないかと思い、削除しました。 Ryo-no-gige は初出なので定訳どおり注釈を加えました。 reportedly はあまり適当ではないのではないかと思い、削除するためにalthogh 以降を変更しました。 必ずしも与えられるものがお金とは限らないので、paid をgiven に変えました。 them → him に訂正しました。

sen.j: 延暦6年には六位の諸王が六位の官職に就いた場合は、その官職の季禄を七位以下の場合は季禄に代わって時服料を授けた。
sen.e: In 787, or 6th year of the Enryaku era, any Shoo (a prince without imperial proclamation), if he was ranked at rokui (the sixth rank) and assigned to any government post of the same sixth rank, could receive kiroku (a stipend paid to government officers) corresponding to his post, while other Shoo who were ranked at shichii (the seventh rank) or lower position were presented with amounts of jifuku instead of kiroku.

sen.cmt: 文をすっきりさせるため、if の位置を変更し、それに従う部分も訂正しました。while 以降のwho were も文をすっきりさせるため削除しました。amount of も削除しました。

sen.j: 同20年には官職についている皇族で上日が不足して季禄が支給されない者には時服料を支給された。
sen.e: In 801, amounts of jifuku were bestowed on some members of Imperial family who were assigned to some jobs for the government but could not receive kiroku (stipend) due to shortage of their service days.
sen.cmt: 「上日」の意味不明ですが、「官職従事期間」の意味に解釈して訳しました。

sen.j: 臣下に対する時服は特定の者に対する褒賞の意味合いで臨時に支給される例もあった（『続日本紀』天平宝字4年11月20日 (旧暦)条）。
sen.e: Jifuku (clothes of the season) were sometimes granted to specific retainers on a temporary basis in the sense of incentive award, according to the Article of November 20, 760 (old calendar) in the "Shoku Nihon-gi" (the "Chronicle of Japan, Continued").

sen.j: 大同 (日本)3年9月20日 (旧暦)詔によって、以後には諸司にも時服を給わることになり、当初は12月から5月までを夏の時服、6月から11月までを冬の時服とし、長上番上および上日が120日以上の者、諸衛は番上80日以上の者、侍従次侍従夜40日以上の者、中務丞内舎人夜50日以上の者に給わった。
sen.e: Sho (Mikotonori, or an edicct of Emperor) of October 17, 808, decided to include many other officials as recipients of jifuku (clothes of the season) and started in the beginning to deliver Summer clothes for the months from December to the next May and Winter clothes for the months from June to November to such retainers, both full-timers and part-timers, as those who attended their offices more than 120 days a year, various guards who served more than 80 days a year, chamberlains and deputy chamberlains who worked more than 40 nights a year, and Nakatsukasanojo (Secretaries of Ministry of Central Affairs) or udoneri (Ministerial equerries) who served more than 50 nights a year.
sen.cmt: ①一原文一訳文の例外対処 ②「中務丞内舎人」の定訳不明。

sen.e: But, later in the year of 809, another Sho (Mikotonori, or an Emperor's edict) was proclaimed to adjust details of necessary service days of civil officers to those of various guards and also set new rules on initial salaries of new comers.

sen.j: 弘仁3年、女官職五位以上の者にたいして、大同年間時服支給を停止されたのを復旧し、弘仁11年、式をさだめ、時服給与にかんする細則を規定した。
sen.e: In 812, jifuku (allocations of cloth) to court ladies of higher ranks than goi (Fifth Rank) resumed, which had been suspended since the Daido era, and, in 820, detailed regulations on allocations of jifuku were set up in a form.

sen.j: 貞観 (日本)12年、豊前王の建議をいれて、王氏で禄を賜う者を429人に限定したが、『延喜式』では、さらに女王にも262人に限定し、いずれも欠員の生じたばあいにのみ、補充されることになった。
sen.e: In 870, Toyosaki-o proposed to limit the number of recipients of stipends among O clan to 429, and his proposal was accepted, while further confinement was posed, as described in "the Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), to limit the number of princesses entitled to stipends to 262, in both cases of which replenishment could be done only when vacancy happened.

sen.j: また、『延喜式』には諸王年12以上に時服を賜うこととし、2世王は絹6匹、糸12絢、調布18端、鍬30口とし、4世王以下は令のごとしとされた。
sen.e: According to "the Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), jifuku (clothes of the season) were bestowed on Shoo (princes without imperial proclamation) of more than twelve years old, more specifically the second generation princes received two rolls (about 50 yards) of silk cloth, twelve spools of yarn, eighteen pieces of about 15m long cloth procured as tax, and thirty spades, while princes of more than four generations were presented with jifuku (clothes of the season) in accordance with the Ryo (administrative law of Ritsuryo codes).

sen.cmt: 「延喜式」「時服」の注釈は既出のため、削除しました。 more specifically の前にand を入れました。 絹の数は６なので、two → six に訂正しました。 最後のcodes は単数にしました。
